item.title: Styx: Blades of Greed delayed into 2026, to ensure the "best possible version of the experience"
item.content:encoded:
Styx: Blades of Greed - the next entry in Cyanide Studio's infiltration series, which plops players into the shoes of a caustic goblin - will now release next year.

"Over the past months, the team has been pushing hard to bring this game to the level it deserves," the studio wrote, with a new release date trailer you can see further below in this article. "We've been polishing systems, tightening the stealth and combat loops, and making sure every area feels as sharp and atmospheric as it should.

"With this extra time, we can deliver the best possible version of the experience we've been building."

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Cyanide Studio said it was "incredibly proud" of the work it has achieved so far, and it is now "even more motivated for the final stretch" of Styx: Blades of Greed's development. "Thank you for sticking with us," it closed. "Your support genuinely fuels the team."

Styx: Blades of Greed was initially set to release this year, but that date has now moved to 19th February, 2026. When it does arrive, it will be available across PC, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S consoles.

Blades of Greed all kicks off after the events of Styx: Shards of Darkness, though the developer has said you won't need to have played any of the previous entries to still enjoy the upcoming release.

I actually got to go hands-on with Styx: Blades of Greed earlier this year, and while I wasn't very good at it (in fact, I was terrible), I had an absolute blast playing as the titular Styx and causing all sorts of chaos for those that got in my way.

item.title: Here are our Xbox Game Pass games for December
item.content:encoded:
Dome Keeper! Mortal Kombat 1! More!

Microsoft has revealed the games coming to its Xbox Game Pass subscription service this December.

Along with Lost Records: Bloom & Rage, which is available across Cloud, PC and Xbox Series X/S from today, Game Pass subscribers can also look forward to the following games making their way onto the service:

  • Monster Train 2 (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) ‚Äì 3rd December, now with Game Pass Premium
  • Spray Paint Simulator (Cloud, Console, and PC) ‚Äì 3rd December, now with Game Pass Premium
  • 33 Immortals (Game Preview) (Cloud, Console, and PC) ‚Äì 4th December, now with Game Pass Premium
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) ‚Äì 4th December, now with Game Pass Premium
  • Routine (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC) ‚Äì 4th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • A Game About Digging A Hole (Cloud, Handheld, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) ‚Äì 9th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Death Howl (Handheld & PC) ‚Äì 9th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Dome Keeper (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC) ‚Äì 9th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Mortal Kombat 1 (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S) ‚Äì 10th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Bratz: Rhythm & Style (Cloud, Console, and PC) ‚Äì 11th December, via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, PC Game Pass

If you haven't given Indiana Jones and the Great Circle a whirl yet, please do. "Smart, fun and so very Indiana Jones, The Great Circle is a stealth action tour de force that marks a bold new era for MachineGames," reads our five star review.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Other games also available on the service that weren't previously announced as part of a Game Pass round up like this include:

  • CloverPit (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Standard, PC Game Pass
  • Marvel Cosmic Invasion (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Total Chaos (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Young Suns (Game Preview) (Cloud, Console, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

Meanwhile, those who are on Game Pass' Essential tier will get the following three games on 3rd December:

  • Stellaris
  • World War Z: Aftermath
  • Medieval Dynasty

As with every month, with new games coming to the Game Pass service, it does mean a selection of games will be leaving the library. On 15th December, the following with be leaving the service:

  • Mortal Kombat 11 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Still Wakes the Deep (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Wildfrost (Cloud, Console, and PC)

Then, on 31st December, these two games will no longer be available on Game Pass:

  • Carrion (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Hell Let Loose (Cloud, Console, and PC)

For everything else in Microsoft's subscription service, you can check out our handy Xbox Game Pass guide detailing the many titles available.

Related topics
